intro: Campanula romanica, commonly known as the Roman bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula romanica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy maintenance.
